lexUnit.name: good.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: kind, benevolent or socially correct.

sentence.text: ` It 's no good getting too fond of her , " Ma had said .
He frowned when reporting this and said it was not good that she should be so hard .
It 's good that the old artists get paid .
It 's good that you came to me .
It 's better when you send me to my room when I 'm naughty .
Weigh up the pros and cons ; decide if it is better to accept such invitations or to spend the time doing your own thing , perhaps sharing a mutual interest with one friend .
Would it be better to warn Terry so it 's not too much of a shock to him if anything happens to Mum ? "
` It 's very good of you to do it , " Merrill said slowly .
Dispensing love and friendship to everyone she met , she was almost too good to be true .

Perhaps it would have been better to use the subjects as springboards for complete fiction , leaving the pedantic detail -- and the risk of libel suits -- behind , and taking off into the story-telling stratosphere .
Well , young lady , I wanted to be good when I was younger , but life has been a struggle for me , and I 've become as hard and tough as a rubber ball .
What is good for the child is often not good for the parent , and vice versa .
` I just hope whoever wins will do their best for the country . "
Your father was always good to me , and his uncle .
The day seemed very long yesterday but I must say my ` bonne " was very good to me .
My Uncle Stan and Aunt Alice are very good to me and more than good to Carrie , they 've given her a start in life she would never have had here .
` Mindless women are no good to anyone -- not themselves , their husbands or their children . "
She took to the good life like a duck to water , " she added wryly .
Do you believe that sin is bad and that virtue is good .
That would be even better and more useful to poor women than the vote , desirable though that might be . "
